speaker: GOWER
text_entry: Here have you seen a mighty king

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: His child, I wis, to incest bring;

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: A better prince and benign lord,

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: That will prove awful both in deed and word.

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: Be quiet then as men should be,

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: Till he hath pass'd necessity.

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: I'll show you those in troubles reign,

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: Losing a mite, a mountain gain.

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: The good in conversation,

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: To whom I give my benison,

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: Is still at Tarsus, where each man

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: Thinks all is writ he speken can;

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: And, to remember what he does,

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: Build his statue to make him glorious:

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: But tidings to the contrary

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: Are brought your eyes; what need speak I?

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: DUMB SHOW.

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: Enter at one door PERICLES talking with CLEON; all  the train with them. Enter at another door a  Gentleman, with a letter to PERICLES; PERICLES  shows the letter to CLEON; gives the Messenger a  reward, and knights him. Exit PERICLES at one door, and CLEON at another

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: Good Helicane, that stay'd at home,

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: Not to eat honey like a drone

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: From others' labours; for though he strive

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: To killen bad, keep good alive;

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: And to fulfil his prince' desire,

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: Sends word of all that haps in Tyre:

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: How Thaliard came full bent with sin

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: And had intent to murder him;

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: And that in Tarsus was not best

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: Longer for him to make his rest.

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: He, doing so, put forth to seas,

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: Where when men been, there's seldom ease;

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: For now the wind begins to blow;

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: Thunder above and deeps below

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: Make such unquiet, that the ship

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: Should house him safe is wreck'd and split;

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: And he, good prince, having all lost,

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: By waves from coast to coast is tost:

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: All perishen of man, of pelf,

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: Ne aught escapen but himself;

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: Till fortune, tired with doing bad,

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: Threw him ashore, to give him glad:

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: And here he comes. What shall be next,

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: Pardon old Gower,--this longs the text.

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: Exit

speaker: SIMONIDES
text_entry: SCENE IV. Tyre. A room in the Governor's house.

speaker: SIMONIDES
text_entry: Enter HELICANUS and ESCANES

speaker: HELICANUS
text_entry: No, Escanes, know this of me,

speaker: HELICANUS
text_entry: Antiochus from incest lived not free:

speaker: HELICANUS
text_entry: For which, the most high gods not minding longer

speaker: HELICANUS
text_entry: To withhold the vengeance that they had in store,

speaker: HELICANUS
text_entry: Due to this heinous capital offence,

speaker: HELICANUS
text_entry: Even in the height and pride of all his glory,

speaker: HELICANUS
text_entry: When he was seated in a chariot

speaker: HELICANUS
text_entry: Of an inestimable value, and his daughter with him,

speaker: HELICANUS
text_entry: A fire from heaven came and shrivell'd up

speaker: HELICANUS
text_entry: Their bodies, even to loathing; for they so stunk,

speaker: HELICANUS
text_entry: That all those eyes adored them ere their fall

speaker: HELICANUS
text_entry: Scorn now their hand should give them burial.

speaker: ESCANES
text_entry: 'Twas very strange.

speaker: HELICANUS
text_entry: And yet but justice; for though

speaker: HELICANUS
text_entry: This king were great, his greatness was no guard

speaker: HELICANUS
text_entry: To bar heaven's shaft, but sin had his reward.

speaker: ESCANES
text_entry: 'Tis very true.

speaker: ESCANES
text_entry: Enter two or three Lords

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: See, not a man in private conference

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: Or council has respect with him but he.

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: It shall no longer grieve without reproof.

speaker: Third Lord
text_entry: And cursed be he that will not second it.

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: Follow me, then. Lord Helicane, a word.

speaker: HELICANUS
text_entry: With me? and welcome: happy day, my lords.

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: Know that our griefs are risen to the top,

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: And now at length they overflow their banks.

speaker: HELICANUS
text_entry: Your griefs! for what? wrong not your prince you love.

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: Wrong not yourself, then, noble Helicane;

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: But if the prince do live, let us salute him,

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: Or know what ground's made happy by his breath.

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: If in the world he live, we'll seek him out;

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: If in his grave he rest, we'll find him there;

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: And be resolved he lives to govern us,

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: Or dead, give's cause to mourn his funeral,

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: And leave us to our free election.

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: Whose death indeed's the strongest in our censure:

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: And knowing this kingdom is without a head,--

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: Like goodly buildings left without a roof

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: Soon fall to ruin,--your noble self,

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: That best know how to rule and how to reign,

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: We thus submit unto,--our sovereign.

speaker: All
text_entry: Live, noble Helicane!

speaker: HELICANUS
text_entry: For honour's cause, forbear your suffrages:

speaker: HELICANUS
text_entry: If that you love Prince Pericles, forbear.

speaker: HELICANUS
text_entry: Take I your wish, I leap into the seas,

speaker: HELICANUS
text_entry: Where's hourly trouble for a minute's ease.

speaker: HELICANUS
text_entry: A twelvemonth longer, let me entreat you to

speaker: HELICANUS
text_entry: Forbear the absence of your king:

speaker: HELICANUS
text_entry: If in which time expired, he not return,

speaker: HELICANUS
text_entry: I shall with aged patience bear your yoke.

speaker: HELICANUS
text_entry: But if I cannot win you to this love,

speaker: HELICANUS
text_entry: Go search like nobles, like noble subjects,

speaker: HELICANUS
text_entry: And in your search spend your adventurous worth;

speaker: HELICANUS
text_entry: Whom if you find, and win unto return,

speaker: HELICANUS
text_entry: You shall like diamonds sit about his crown.

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: To wisdom he's a fool that will not yield;

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: And since Lord Helicane enjoineth us,

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: We with our travels will endeavour us.

speaker: HELICANUS
text_entry: Then you love us, we you, and we'll clasp hands:

speaker: HELICANUS
text_entry: When peers thus knit, a kingdom ever stands.

speaker: HELICANUS
text_entry: Exeunt
